title: Would I be correct in saying that the real issue with with Riot's balance team...
body:
...is that too often they change too many things about a champion or role at once without showing any sort of caution.

Right now, people aren't necessarily annoyed by the fact that Ahri got nerfed, or that DFG got removed - they're annoyed by the fact that that both were done in a single patch.

What should Riot have done? They should have removed DFG and left Ahri untouched for Patch 5.2 and identified things such as what item Ahri players substituted DFG with, how much her overall power decreased (if at all), whether it altered the timing of her power spike, or if her play pattern changed.

I would have been up the the challenge. Is Lich Bane a suitable replacement? A different item to provide the missing CDR? Could I become slightly more CC-oriented and build a Rylai's? Or could I offset the missing damage by purchasing Seraph's embrace or some other high-AP value item?

I always got Double Dorans and Morellonomicon early. DFG was only my 3rd or 4th item most of the time and I rarely even needed the Active.

Riot's sort of "damned if they do, damned if they don't" in this situation. When they change things quickly, people complain about it (like you pointed out), but if they do so too slowly, people complain about it. I can't tell you how many "Well, you guys removed DFG, where's {{champion:45}} {{champion:82}} buffs?" posts I've seen here.
That's what the PBE is for. That's probably why they did Ahri and Fizz first.
You pretty much just detailed the internal testing phase from how I understand it. There are players of all skill levels in Riot and they internally play test all the time for this exact reason.

Ahri didn't get nerfed. DFG was a crutch item for Ahri, never built it. 
My build is pretty much Abysal Zhonya Boots core and whatever the situation calls for after that. Usually deathcap and sometimes lichbane.
